folder: New Lots Avenue & Sheffield Avenue, Brooklyn, NY
original_title: Brooklyn: New Lots Avenue - Sheffield Avenue
text:
341 New Lots Ave., at the N.W. corner of Sheffield Ave., showing the Lindon house built by the Rapelye family for one of their daughters. This house was demolished on March 18, 1929. In the same year, a 2-story
brick building was erected on the site.
1922.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.

folder: New Lots Avenue & Sheffield Avenue, Brooklyn, NY
original_title: Brooklyn: New Lots Avenue - Sheffield Avenue
text:
(1)
349 New Lots Ave., at the N.E. corner of Sheffield Ave., showing the remains of a building erected in 1750, by Daniel Rapelye. Ethan Allen was billeted in this house. To the west of this house, on the N.W. corner of Pennsylvania Ave., was the home erected by William Rapelye in 1875 (1). Both of these houses were demolished in May 1922.
1922.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
(2)
The same, showing the dutch baking ovens of the Rapelye house. 1929, the whole frontage including these sites, was occupied by
3-story brick buildings.
1922.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
